title: Freedom4All
author: Freedom4All
created_time: June 27, 2023, 01:31:03 AMLast edit: June 29, 2023, 12:44:48 AM by Freedom4All
content: I want to promote crypto related products or services but no illegal activities, items or services.Hello everyone,I set up a website in 2019 mainly aimed at Dutch speakers.The website is an independent news and opinion website with loyal followers.This originated just before the corona crisis. It's not an affiliate website. There is exactly one advertisement from a regular reader of ours. I never wanted to monetize this website and not participate in GoogleAds and Affiliate programs from the "ordinary world". Principally not. I tried AdSense but removed it again.Our readers are mainly adults from 30 years old and all ages above.We have a newsletter with hundreds of subscribed readers. We have a clean chat/comment section. It is moderated to keep trolls away. It's a serious website with multiple writers. 5 regular writers and in total we have around 10 writers. Mainly columnists and news bringers who bring substantiated news (and often add their opinion).Now I'm looking for sponsors.. Not only out of necessity but also because I myself love cryptos. I'm not an expert in it but the BTC has brought me a lot of good in the past. People on our website are also mainly interested in privacy, buy VPNs, and are afraid of the disappearance of cash and a centralized digital coin.Of course, there are also people in our base who gamble but are driven crazy by the control.I think an audience with beginning crypto enthusiasts can be valuable for our readers, for me, and for the sponsor/blog writer/advertiser etcetera.For more information, PM me or ask here.I would like to hear from "the good people" whether it is wise to post the link of my website directly here or only to potentially interested parties.Also, if someone has tips. Much appreciated!Website:commonsensetv.nl

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: Freedom4All on June 27, 2023, 01:31:03 AMI set up a website in 2019 mainly aimed at Dutch speakers.The website is an independent news and opinion website with loyal followers.It is definitely necessary to better define your site and the approximate offer you expectQuoteI never wanted to monetize this website and not participate in GoogleAds and Affiliate programs from the "ordinary world". Principally not.What is wrong with Google Ads or Affiliate Programs even from the ordinary world? Why do you think it is desirable to avoid it? It is a completely legitimate way to do business.QuoteI tried AdSense but removed it againAgain, it is unclear why you turn off the ad network, while at the same time you are looking for sponsors. Certainly, AdSense is not the only one, there are other choices.Quote from: Freedom4All on June 27, 2023, 01:31:03 AMOur readers are mainly adults from 30 years old and all ages above.We have a newsletter with hundreds of subscribed readers. We have a clean chat/comment section. It is moderated to keep trolls away. It's a serious website with multiple writers. You have to provide more precise statistics, this seems like your guesswork. If you are not going to share the link to the site, you should provide basic information, the daily number of visits to the site and at least some demographic information about the visitors.

comments.author: Accardo
comments.body: Quote from: examplens on June 27, 2023, 06:08:31 AMQuote from: Freedom4All on June 27, 2023, 01:31:03 AMI set up a website in 2019 mainly aimed at Dutch speakers.The website is an independent news and opinion website with loyal followers.It is definitely necessary to better define your site and the approximate offer you expectQuoteI never wanted to monetize this website and not participate in GoogleAds and Affiliate programs from the "ordinary world". Principally not.What is wrong with Google Ads or Affiliate Programs even from the ordinary world? Why do you think it is desirable to avoid it? It is a completely legitimate way to do business.A lot of disadvantages follows Google AdSense, especially for small publishers like OP. Google doesn't provide enough sponsor for small websites and also the rules are much and the publisher can lose all their money in a second for boycotting any rule or policies. When working with ad network they're more like the admin of the site, as they can influence the kind of activities they want on your website, suspicious clicks can lead to the termination of the account, and they is nobody to run to. The whole hard work ends in losses. Quite good it's a nice way yo monetize a website, but not all webmasters wants to be under a foreign control, they prefer to streamline the activities of their website gradually and grow. OP seeking for support is excellent for a growing site.

comments.author: GH2022
comments.body: Quote from: Freedom4All on June 27, 2023, 01:31:03 AMHello everyone,I set up a website in 2019 mainly aimed at Dutch speakers.The website is an independent news and opinion website with loyal followers.This originated just before the corona crisis. It's not an affiliate website. There is exactly one advertisement from a regular reader of ours. I never wanted to monetize this website and not participate in GoogleAds and Affiliate programs from the "ordinary world". Principally not. I tried AdSense but removed it again.Our readers are mainly adults from 30 years old and all ages above.We have a newsletter with hundreds of subscribed readers. We have a clean chat/comment section. It is moderated to keep trolls away. It's a serious website with multiple writers. 5 regular writers and in total we have around 10 writers. Mainly columnists and news bringers who bring substantiated news (and often add their opinion).Now I'm looking for sponsors.. Not only out of necessity but also because I myself love cryptos. I'm not an expert in it but the BTC has brought me a lot of good in the past. People on our website are also mainly interested in privacy, buy VPNs, and are afraid of the disappearance of cash and a centralized digital coin.Of course, there are also people in our base who gamble but are driven crazy by the control.I think an audience with beginning crypto enthusiasts can be valuable for our readers, for me, and for the sponsor/blog writer/advertiser etcetera.For more information, PM me or ask here.I would like to hear from "the good people" whether it is wise to post the link of my website directly here or only to potentially interested parties.Also, if someone has tips. Much appreciated!I'd be quite happy to write for you, if you'd accept submissions written in English which you could then translate into Dutch (as I gather that Google Translate isn't always 100% accurate).What sort of articles/blogs would you require and what would you pay in terms of Bitcoin?  Your site sounds interesting, and I too am against the disappearance of cash if it means ever more draconian rule by 'Big Daddy Government'.My DM should be open, if you'd like to send me a message.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Quote from: Freedom4All on June 27, 2023, 01:31:03 AMI would like to hear from "the good people" whether it is wise to post the link of my website directly here or only to potentially interested parties.Unless it's referral links, that's okay.You talked a lot and did not tell us about the details of the news site. Are the articles only in Dutch or are they approved in English? If it is only Dutch, it is better to publish it in the local council.How to make payments, is it in bitcoins, if so, move the topic to the services section.Are there specialized articles on bitcoin or is it a news site and you are looking for advertisers and who publish the articles, what are the appropriate years of experience and what are the necessary translation capabilities and how much do you plan to pay.Quote from: Freedom4All on June 27, 2023, 01:31:03 AMAlso, if someone has tips. Much appreciated!Fewer ads and unbiased, in-depth articles are better.

comments.author: Freedom4All
comments.body: Since my native language is Dutch, that won't be a problem at all. When I do something for someone, I do it well.In response to the question of which Bitcoin-related articles would best suit the website, we can coordinate together. I know my audience, I think about what fits best with us and I hope after my explanation you will have an idea too? A simple example is a 1000-word explanation for people who want to enter the crypto world. A sincere article with the right links.For example, a guide on how to get started with Bitcoins. Or a video. We can advertise with a separate section on the website where we provide more explanation.We must meet the demands of the people.I have nothing against just a simple advertisement or a general article, it will certainly get views with good SEO. But a really good approach is to really involve people in the service and teach them how to purchase cryptos, how to do this as anonymously as possible.A casino is another story, but as long as it's a fair casino, there's plenty to think about how to get people there. Perhaps we can give away bonuses in the right way on the website without the entire website being full of gambling advertisements.I'm just giving some examples. These are real people to whom you are offering your product. People from "the offline world", can I describe it like that? Not sure if some typical Dutch expressions also make sense in English As long as everything remains legal, I am obv. not going to post for scamsites, I believe there are numerous possibilities. Don't overlook the newsletter and the social media platforms that are linked to the website as well.When we devise a plan, I'm confident we can agree on a price that is suitable for both of us. If the business is truly serious and I find it appealing, we could start with a small project, such as writing some blog posts as an initial task, and brainstorm other ideas together in the meantime.We can get in contact any way you like. I just still have a PM limit of just 1 or a few today here.This is the website btw:commonsensetv.nl

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: You have a good choice of picking a good magazine theme for your WordPress site, if you're looking for advertisers and sponsors,  you have to show your site data and ranking, there are plugins that you can install and activate to show your site ranking and data.I recommend that you put the translator where the visitors can easily see it not at the bottom of the page, the archives and the tag widgets are best placed below you should put recent articles above the archive and tags, that's how I configure my blog.I recommend that if you are going to accept sponsors it should be related to your content, I don't know why you are looking for casinos to sponsor your site when your blog has nothing to do with gambling.Honestly, your blog is ok you can easily get a local sponsor, have you reached out to local projects to advertise on your blog? Your domain extension is country targeted which is .nl Quote.nl is the Internet country code top-level domain for the Netherlands. so it is very suited for projects that are located in the Netherlands.I'm sure you can get one it's just how you present your blog.

comments.author: Freedom4All
comments.created_time: June 27, 2023, 11:54:04 AMLast edit: June 27, 2023, 12:06:44 PM by Freedom4All
comments.body: Thank you, Robelneo,The stats I have from Jetpack. For sure there are tools online as well to check the traffic.https://ibb.co/BgFRTDYI used Analytics for a while, but decided to switch back to Jetpack for more detailed insights. This site once had over 100,000 page views during the Corona period.All-Time stats (from 1st of October 2019)https://ibb.co/DbLbt9z

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: Quote from: Freedom4All on June 27, 2023, 11:54:04 AMThank you, Robelneo,The stats I have from Jetpack. For sure there are tools online as well to check the traffic.https://ibb.co/BgFRTDYI used Analytics for a while, but decided to switch back to Jetpack for more detailed insights. This site once had over 100,000 page views during the Corona period.All-Time stats (from 1st of October 2019)https://ibb.co/DbLbt9zYou should create a page for your stat or use a dedicated widget to show it on the sidebar, one thing I also notice is why there is a page for editing your profile I know that this is a membership site but when it comes to editing a profile it is already available when a user login.Since you are looking for sponsors why not create a dedicated page for this and on that page explain the benefits of having their ads on your blog you can also post your traffic stat to entice or convince your potential sponsors that its worth sponsoring your blog and advertise on your blog.

comments.author: Freedom4All
comments.body: That is definitely a good idea, and my mind has been filled with similar ideas recently. I actually have two other domains as well.The main issue here is that it takes up too much of my time, even though it's relatively easy. Setting it up at this absurd point in my life requires a significant amount of time, as I first need to secure a quick and legitimate high-quality deal in BCT. I posted my situation on the forum in various topics, albeit perhaps a bit lengthy, but understandably, people have many questions.

comments.author: Zoomic
comments.body: Quote from: robelneo on June 27, 2023, 01:04:23 PMQuote from: Freedom4All on June 27, 2023, 11:54:04 AMThank you, Robelneo,The stats I have from Jetpack. For sure there are tools online as well to check the traffic.https://ibb.co/BgFRTDYI used Analytics for a while, but decided to switch back to Jetpack for more detailed insights. This site once had over 100,000 page views during the Corona period.All-Time stats (from 1st of October 2019)https://ibb.co/DbLbt9zYou should create a page for your stat or use a dedicated widget to show it on the sidebar, one thing I also notice is why there is a page for editing your profile I know that this is a membership site but when it comes to editing a profile it is already available when a user login.Since you are looking for sponsors why not create a dedicated page for this and on that page explain the benefits of having their ads on your blog you can also post your traffic stat to entice or convince your potential sponsors that its worth sponsoring your blog and advertise on your blog.Op has a very good stat that is worthy to be displayed. Considering your advice to have a dedicated widget to display the stat of his site is cool but I also know that most times the stats are being exaggerated, more than they really are.

comments.author: Freedom4All
comments.body: Thank you, Zoomic,I am doing that now. I have another domain. I know I can figure out how to do it, but it will take some time.I am on it, I just am in a scary personal situation. That's why I am so eager for a loan and a quick deal with an advertiser so I can build my project(s) without stress. This has never happened to me before. Ridiculous situations can arise.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: Freedom4All on June 27, 2023, 01:38:31 PMThat is definitely a good idea, and my mind has been filled with similar ideas recently. I actually have two other domains as well.The main issue here is that it takes up too much of my time, even though it's relatively easy. Setting it up at this absurd point in my life requires a significant amount of time, as I first need to secure a quick and legitimate high-quality deal in BCT. I posted my situation on the forum in various topics, albeit perhaps a bit lengthy, but understandably, people have many questions.Suddenly you started writing over the forum, mostly asking for money. No matter whether is it a loan or selling ad space. Desperate moves and rashness are definitely not a good solution and you need to slow down a bit. You have already received enough suggestions, present your pages, give some details about traffic, number of visits, the average stay on the site and similar and present your offer. Who is ready to enter into a deal with you if it is obvious that there is a great possibility of selling the site in the case of an offer that meets your needs at the moment?I saw that you have solid traffic, but it is mainly from the Netherlands, so you are limited to services that may be interesting to your visitors. Also, you need to study a little more on this forum, you will see that there are different ways to monetize your blog. Here is an example, as far as I can see this is still active [BOUNTY] GOLD Stablecoin – $200,000 - payouts in BTC, ETH, GOLDQuote from: Accardo on June 27, 2023, 08:47:20 AMA lot of disadvantages follows Google AdSense, especially for small publishers like OP. Google doesn't provide enough sponsor for small websites and also the rules are much and the publisher can lose all their money in a second for boycotting any rule or policies. When working with ad network they're more like the admin of the site, as they can influence the kind of activities they want on your website, suspicious clicks can lead to the termination of the account, and they is nobody to run to. The whole hard work ends in losses. Quite good it's a nice way yo monetize a website, but not all webmasters wants to be under a foreign control, they prefer to streamline the activities of their website gradually and grow. OP seeking for support is excellent for a growing site. You only present the potentially negative aspects of Adsense here. Looking at it this way, it's a wonder that anyone uses AdSense as a monetization method. The reality is a little different, and in any ad network, if you use illegitimate methods for clicks, there is definitely a risk of being banned. The fact that the ad network is the admin of your site is total nonsense because it is possible to set in detail what you want to be displayed in your ad spaces. In the end, I said that Adsense is not the only option, there are many others, almost the same, some even with a better payment rate

comments.author: Freedom4All
comments.body: Thanks for the advice.But I answered alll this questions like 5 times spread around this forum.Also my motives for a loan.So, I am looking for a lender who might be interested or even better, I want to sell website space.

Considering your advice to have a dedicated widget to display the stat of his site is cool but I also know that most times the stats are being exaggerated, more than they really are.Thank you for this.A potential advertiser will have acces to all the stats, ofcourse.

comments.author: aioc
comments.body: Quote from: Freedom4All on June 28, 2023, 10:54:55 AMThanks for the advice.But I answered alll this questions like 5 times spread around this forum.Also my motives for a loan.So, I am looking for a lender who might be interested or even better, I want to sell website space.I've checked your post history and it centered on your loan you are still at it although there are who already commented to drop your loan, it's better to lock your loan request and move on, and just use other options to get money to fund your project.This forum can only accept collateral that lenders can dispose of to recover the loan amount and what you offer is something that will not satisfy some lenders just accept this fact, you just have to do better with what you have.Or better build your reputation here and do bounty campaigns using your platform who knows you can stumble over a good project that will reward you.

comments.author: Freedom4All
comments.body: I would, if it was not so urgent.That part is so private I just can´t post it here.You would understand me. But your observation is right. I will consider it.

comments.author: Accardo
comments.body: Quote from: examplens on June 28, 2023, 10:42:27 AMQuote from: Accardo on June 27, 2023, 08:47:20 AMA lot of disadvantages follows Google AdSense, especially for small publishers like OP. Google doesn't provide enough sponsor for small websites and also the rules are much and the publisher can lose all their money in a second for boycotting any rule or policies. When working with ad network they're more like the admin of the site, as they can influence the kind of activities they want on your website, suspicious clicks can lead to the termination of the account, and they is nobody to run to. The whole hard work ends in losses. Quite good it's a nice way yo monetize a website, but not all webmasters wants to be under a foreign control, they prefer to streamline the activities of their website gradually and grow. OP seeking for support is excellent for a growing site. You only present the potentially negative aspects of Adsense here. Looking at it this way, it's a wonder that anyone uses AdSense as a monetization method. The reality is a little different, and in any ad network, if you use illegitimate methods for clicks, there is definitely a risk of being banned. The fact that the ad network is the admin of your site is total nonsense because it is possible to set in detail what you want to be displayed in your ad spaces. In the end, I said that Adsense is not the only option, there are many others, almost the same, some even with a better payment rateOf course they're multiple advantages of Adsense, but that doesn't make my response nonsense, because a site admin may not change niche or content type that is against Google's policy without getting banned. For instance, google adsense may not accept a cryptocurrency blog and Op wants to switch his contents toward crypto, if he is working with adsense would he do that without getting banned and lose already generated funds? They may not be the general admin, but the adnetwork has influence over your site, and you must abide by their rules, you are no longer the sole proprietor of what happens in the site. In addition, monetizing adsense has to do with the tier of traffic that visits your site and their CPA. If OP's visitors are from tier3 what gain is it to choose google adsense or an adnetwork as sponsors. It will take ages for the site to yield him much profits. Webmasters with Tier1 traffics are advised to use google adsense as they have higher CPA on Ads published on the page. However, the site OP is running is not yet big like I said, and it's a factor to consider, before jumping into adnetworks regardless of the company whether Adsense or PropellerAds

comments.author: Freedom4All
comments.body: I needed a few days to see how things work here. It changed a lot.I will make a new topic.

It also means how many years were wasted in this incident on your website? Well, it's not too late for that.
